channel.title: [667/771] Npc drops, can someone explain?
channel.description:
I have been searching and gathering information about the ".d" files, It is used to pack the NPC drops in the 667-source, and I can't find anything to open up this file.
I have read some articles, and heard people talking about making their own app for unpacking and packing those .d files. Can anyone help me with this? Maybe teaching me how to make a .d file editor?
Greets, Phallanx.

item.title: [667/771] Npc drops, can someone explain?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

jal knight:

The file ending with .d is just meanind drops. Like someone mentioned before you need the unpacked file. If you search around a little bit you’ll find them. ALSO i recommend staying away from those servers because they are EXTREMELY bugged. You’ll add in an npc or drop then the next thing you know a lot of the npcs only have 1 hp or you cant get to nex. a lot can go wrong.

Not to be rude but the file extension isn’t .d because it contains the npcDrops. That is just ridiculous.

Read full topic

item.title: [667/771] Npc drops, can someone explain?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

.d (and i think .p) are like alien encrypted :P, you either need the uncompiled files or the compiler/encrypter used by the the creator of it…

also dont you mean 667/711?
lol 771 hasnt been released by jagex yet

Read full topic

item.title: [667/771] Npc drops, can someone explain?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

A file with the extension of .d, is not editable. Think of it as a class file, instead of a java.

You need the original, uncompressed version first, then you must go into the server and make sure the file properly formats and packs.

Read full topic
